intro: Sterculia katangensis, commonly known as the Katanga sterculia, is a tropical tree native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, reddish-yellow flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. It is typically found in moist, lowland forests and plays a role in local ecosystems. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
